page.title: 19Trade in Ripe.
page.content: There are two shops and a public house in the area. Ripe Stores and Post Office sells groceries, greengroceries, chemists goods and a little selection of hardware, sweets and off-licence goods. It is also the local sub-Post Office. The Post Office is well patronised, being more friendly and convenient than a large Main Office and also much quicker. The couple who run the shop are John and Jean Sanderson and they try to cater for every taste. If you really want something that is not on the shelves, they will be only too happy to get it on their next visit to the wholesaler.The Post Office is a great asset to the village. Pensions and Childrens Allowances are paid out and dog licenses, Television Licences and postage stamps are sold. The National Girobank is widely used in Ripe.
